function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of metal nanoparticles in high-performance coatings may pose a risk of environmental contamination and toxicity.","Impact":"Uncontrolled release of metal nanoparticles into the environment can lead to ecological damage and human health hazards.","Mitigation":"Implementation of strict regulations and guidelines for handling and disposal of metal nanoparticles.","Technologies":"Nanoparticle encapsulation and controlled release technologies.","People":"Environmental workers, researchers, and the general public.","Owner":"Regulatory bodies and research institutions."},{"Description":"Potential risks associated with the use of graphene-based coatings for antiviral applications, including unknown long-term health effects and environmental impact.","Impact":"Uncertainty about the impact on human health and the environment could lead to unforeseen consequences.","Mitigation":"Long-term monitoring of health and environmental effects, and development of safe handling protocols.","Technologies":"Advanced monitoring and testing technologies for health and environmental impacts.","People":"Researchers, healthcare workers, and the general public.","Owner":"Health and environmental regulatory agencies."},{"Description":"Challenges related to poor solubility and processing of graphene oxide (GO) may hinder the fabrication of antimicrobial coatings.","Impact":"Difficulty in achieving effective antimicrobial coatings on high-contact surfaces, leading to potential spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Research and development of improved solubility and processing methods for GO.","Technologies":"Nanotechnology and material science advancements for GO modification.","People":"Manufacturers of high-contact surfaces, healthcare workers, and the general public.","Owner":"Research institutions and companies in material science and nanotechnology."}]}
